title: [BUG] Failing running repos with submodules

labels.name: has-closing-pr
labels.description: This issue has a closing PR

body:
### Issues Policy acknowledgement

- [X] I have read and agree to submit bug reports in accordance with the [issues policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)

### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.

### MLflow version

- Client: 1.30.0


### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Linux Ubuntu 22.04
- **Python version**: 3.9.13


### Describe the problem

When executing a repo with submodules using `mlflow run ...` the submodule folder remains empty and, therefore, the execution fails.

I can fix this by changing the way mlflow handles submodule initialization: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/commit/22350122d4079fa8142d158dfa3420218a62f0fc

Has anyone experience a similar problem? Or knows whether this is just a `GitPython` issue?

### Tracking information

_No response_

### Code to reproduce issue

Execute a repo with submodule using `mlflow run ...`. The submodule is not correctly initialized
